intro: Grindelia rubricaulis var. robusta, commonly known as the robust tarplant, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It has a taproot system and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The species is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in arid environments.
